title: North Korea is fueling rocket, U.S. military says

content: Shooting it down is a really bad idea. we should let them launch it, odds are good it will do what the last one did. The last TD-2 blew up seconds after launch. The one launched July 4, 2006, I was on duty as an orbital analyst in Cheynenne Mountain. It made for an intersting day since the space shuttle went up right afterwards. It was the two big events we trained for and I got them both in the matter of an hour.
reply: Shooting it down is a really bad idea. we should let them launch it, odds are good it will do what the last one did. The last TD-2 blew up seconds after launch. It was the two big events we trained for and I got them both in the matter of an hour.

title: North Korea is fueling rocket, U.S. military says

content: That thing needs to be shot down. If it makes a sucessful launch then we will be seeing them in Iran and any other country with some cash. I think that this is a sales pitch for the North Koreans. If they launch it they can say see we have a long range missle who wants one? But if someone shoots it down and shows how easy it is to do so then there may not be a line of buyers....just my thought on the whole thing.
reply: That thing needs to be shot down. If it makes a sucessful launch then we will be seeing them in Iran and any other country with some cash. title: North Korea is fueling rocket, U.S. military says

content: CNN is reporting that US military officials looking at satellite imagery believe that the rocket has a bulbous fairing on top. By our standards that would indicate a satellite for a payload, rather than a warhead.

That is easy for you to say, you wouldn't be thrown into an all out war with N Korea. Shooting down a rocket launch is an act of war. N Korea is unstable, but we have no justification to shoot down their rockets unless they are targeted at us.

If it makes a sucessful launch then we will be seeing them in Iran and any other country with some cash. I think that this is a sales pitch for the North Koreans. If they launch it they can say see we have a long range missle who wants one? But if someone shoots it down and shows how easy it is to do so then there may not be a line of buyers....just my thought on the whole thing. That is easy for you to say, you wouldn't be thrown into an all out war with N Korea. Shooting down a rocket launch is an act of war. What response would you think would be warranted if one of our satellite launches was shot down? N Korea is unstable, but we have no justification to shoot down their rockets unless they are targeted at us. this instability is reason enough!
quote: Originally posted by nspreitler: quote: Originally posted by alzuk: That thing needs to be shot down. If it makes a sucessful launch then we will be seeing them in Iran and any other country with some cash. I think that this is a sales pitch for the North Koreans. If they launch it they can say see we have a long range missle who wants one? But if someone shoots it down and shows how easy it is to do so then there may not be a line of buyers....just my thought on the whole thing. That is easy for you to say, you wouldn't be thrown into an all out war with N Korea. Shooting down a rocket launch is an act of war. What response would you think would be warranted if one of our satellite launches was shot down? N Korea is unstable, but we have no justification to shoot down their rockets unless they are targeted at us.
reply: this instability is reason enough!
title: North Korea is fueling rocket, U.S. military says

content: Is it? I don't agree. Let that region take care of the problem. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin

content: Most of you are missing the point. This is a UN resolution, not just a US resolution. To allow it to fly, fail or no fail will allow the great leader to correct his mistakes and move foward. Shoot it down.

content: It will be interesting to see what happens. If it is shot down I expect North Korea will launch a barrage of No-Dong MRBMs at Japan and SCUDS at South Korea. Let's hope it doesn't happen because 2ID will be in a real mess if N Korea crosses that border.
